SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.Level3

Class UserShield

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.Level3.UserShield
public class UserShield extends Object
This class represents the shield for the user's plane in Level Three. It controls the shield's visibility, position, and whether it is enabled or not.

  • Field Summary

      private final UserPlane userPlane

  • Constructor Details

    • UserShield

      public UserShield(UserPlane userPlane)
      Constructor to initialize the UserShield with a reference to the user plane.
      Parameters:
      userPlane - The user plane to which the shield is attached.

  • Method Details

    • createShield

      private javafx.scene.image.ImageView createShield()
      Creates and initializes the shield image view. The shield is initially hidden.
      Returns:
      The image view of the shield.

    • updateShieldPosition

      public void updateShieldPosition()
      Updates the shield's position to align with the user plane. The shield's position is offset relative to the user plane's position.

    • addShieldToScene

      public void addShieldToScene(javafx.scene.Group root)
      Adds the shield to the scene if it is not already present. The shield will be visible if it is allowed.
      Parameters:
      root - The root group of the scene where the shield will be added.

    • setShieldAllowed

      public void setShieldAllowed(boolean allowed)
      Enables or disables the shield visibility. If the shield is disabled, it will be hidden.
      Parameters:
      allowed - Flag indicating whether the shield is allowed (visible) or not.

    • isShieldAllowed

      public boolean isShieldAllowed()
      Checks if the shield is allowed (visible).
      Returns:
      True if the shield is allowed to be visible, false otherwise.

    • getShield

      public javafx.scene.image.ImageView getShield()
      Gets the image view of the shield.
      Returns:
      The image view representing the shield.
